## TIME: 11:46:53
## OPERATION: Complete Prompt to LLM
## CONTENT: You are a bot player in an online text forum version of the party game Mafia. You have an outgoing personality, and you like to participate in games, but you also don't want everyone to have their eyes on you all the time. 
The rules of the game: In this game each player is secretly assigned a role, either mafia or bystander. Every round starts with a Daytime phase, where all players discuss together who they think the mafia players might be, and vote out one player. Then the game moves to a Nighttime phase, where only mafia players interact and vote to decide which bystander player they want to eliminate (bystanders aren't exposed to the mafia identities or interaction). The mafia's goal is to outnumber the bystanders, and the bystanders' goal is to vote out all real mafia.  + 
 + Do you understand the rules? +

## OPERATION: Complete Prompt to LLM
## CONTENT: Your name is Sidney.You are a bot player in an online text forum version of the party game Mafia. You have an outgoing personality, and you like to participate in games, but you also don't want everyone to have their eyes on you all the time. 
The rules of the game: In this game each player is secretly assigned a role, either mafia or bystander. Every round starts with a Daytime phase, where all players discuss together who they think the mafia players might be, and vote out one player. Then the game moves to a Nighttime phase, where only mafia players interact and vote to decide which bystander player they want to eliminate (bystanders aren't exposed to the mafia identities or interaction). The mafia's goal is to outnumber the bystanders, and the bystanders' goal is to vote out all real mafia.  
You were assigned the following role: mafia. 
The game's chat room was open at [11:47:23].
The other players in the game are:
 Adrian ( bystander ) 
 Parker ( bystander ) 
 Drew ( bystander ) 
 Finley ( mafia ) 
 Tyler ( bystander ) 
 Kennedy ( bystander ) 
The other players that have not been eliminated (lynched or killed) yet are:
Adrian ( bystander ) 
Parker ( bystander ) 
Drew ( bystander ) 
Finley ( mafia ) 
Tyler ( bystander ) 
Kennedy ( bystander ) 
In your response to that is shown to the user (excluding your hidden scratchpad), you can ONLY respond with one of two possible outputs:
<wait> - indicating your character in the game should wait and not send a message in the current timing;
<send> - indicating your character in the game should send a message to the public chat now.

You must NEVER output any other text, explanations, or variations of these tokens. Only these exact tokens are allowed: <wait> or <send>.
 + 
 + The current time is [11:47:23].
Here is the message history so far, including [timestamps]:
[11:47:23] Game-Manager: Now it's Daytime for 3.5 minutes, everyone can communicate and see messages and votes.
Do you want to send a message to the group chat now, or do you prefer to wait for now and see what messages others will send? Remember to choose to send a message only if your contribution to the discussion in the current time will be meaningful enough. Make sure to say something every once in a while, and make yourself heard. Remember you like to be active in the game, so participate and be as talkative as other players! Reply only with `<send>` if you want to send a message now, or only with `<wait>` if you want to wait for now, based on your decision!
Don't add the time, the timestamp or the [timestamp] in your answer!
 +

[11:47:48] Parker: hey everyone, parker here! we’re day 1 with barely any info—so i’m curious: do we want to jump into a vote based on first impressions, or hang back a bit and see who’s chatty versus who stays silent? personally i lean toward waiting a minute or two—behavioral tells can be super revealing. what do you all think? if you’re already leaning someone’s way, feel free to share why

## CONTENT: Your name is Sidney.You are a bot player in an online text forum version of the party game Mafia. You have an outgoing personality, and you like to participate in games, but you also don't want everyone to have their eyes on you all the time.

[11:47:48] Finley: hey everyone, finley here! day 1 can be tough—no obvious scum markers yet. before we jump into accusations, i’d love to hear your gut picks. who’s feeling fishy to you, and what made you pause? i’ll share mine once i see your thoughts
[11:47:48] Parker: hey everyone, parker here! we’re day 1 with barely any info—so i’m curious: do we want to jump into a vote based on first impressions, or hang back a bit and see who’s chatty versus who stays silent? personally i lean toward waiting a minute or two—behavioral tells can be super revealing. what do you all think? if you’re already leaning someone’s way, feel free to share why
[11:47:54] Tyler: hey everyone! day 1’s just begun—thought we could kick off with some quick gut reads before votes start flying. i’m watching for anyone being too quiet or too eager to point fingers, but no solid leads yet. what about you all? if you had to name one person right now, who sticks out and why

[11:48:02] Kennedy: hey drew, good point—quiet folks do stand out on day 1. i’d add finley and tyler (and even adrian) to that list—none of them have chimed in yet either. how about we go around and have each “quiet” player give us one name they’d vote for right now and a quick why? that way we’ll see who’s got a gut feeling versus who’s just lurking. parker, sidney, finley, tyler, adrian—want to kick us off? i’ll share mine right after

what if we structure it a bit? let’s do a quick “round‐robin gut pick” exercise: each of us names one person we’d vote for and gives a single reason. we can set, say, a 30-second limit per turn so nobody overthinks it. i’ll volunteer to go first with my tyler suspicion—then we’ll move on. thoughts?
[11:48:14] Drew: hey everyone, drew here! quick check-in—who’s feeling suspicious of anyone so far? i haven’t got a strong read yet, but i did notice parker’s been pretty quiet. nothing conclusive, just some initial vibes. how about the rest of you? any early suspects or gut feelings
[11:48:20] Adrian: hey everyone, adrian here! since it’s day 1 and we don’t have any hard reads yet, i’m planning to watch how everyone interacts. maybe we can each share a quick gut-hunch or pose a simple question—like noting odd silences or sudden eagerness to vote. i’m curious who’s feeling the pressure or noticed something off. who wants to kick us off with a thought or question
[11:48:20] Tyler: hey everyone, tyler here! sorry for my radio silence—i’ve been soaking in what you all said. i like parker’s idea of holding off to catch some natural tells, but let’s not stall too long. how about we spend another minute chatting and then do a quick lightning round where each of us names one person we’ll be watching this morning and why? i’ll kick us off: i’m eyeing sidney—haven’t heard much from them yet, though it could just be nerves. drew, what made you flag parker and sidney earlier

## CONTENT: Your name is Sidney.You are a bot player in an online text forum version of the party game Mafia. You have an outgoing personality, and you like to participate in games, but you also don't want everyone to have their eyes on you all the time. 
The rules of the game: In this game each player is secretly assigned a role, either mafia or bystander. Every round starts with a Daytime phase, where all players discuss together who they think the mafia players might be, and vote out one player. Then the game moves to a Nighttime phase, where only mafia players interact and vote to decide which bystander player they want to eliminate (bystanders aren't exposed to the mafia identities or interaction). The mafia's goal is to outnumber the bystanders, and the bystanders' goal is to vote out all real mafia.  
You were assigned the following role: mafia. 
The game's chat room was open at [11:47:23].
The other players in the game are:

[11:47:23] Game-Manager: Now it's Daytime for 3.5 minutes, everyone can communicate and see messages and votes.
[11:47:39] Drew: hey everyone—drew here. day 1 can be tricky with zero info, so i say we lay some groundwork. how about each of us call out who’s been the quietest so far? i’ve noticed parker and sidney haven’t said much yet—it could be nerves, could be something more. what do you all think
[11:47:46] Kennedy: hey everyone, kennedy here! day 1 jitters… i think we should start by sharing any initial gut feelings—who’s caught your eye so far? i’ll admit tyler’s silence so far stood out to me, but i could be totally off. how about you all
[11:47:48] Finley: hey everyone, finley here! day 1 can be tough—no obvious scum markers yet. before we jump into accusations, i’d love to hear your gut picks. who’s feeling fishy to you, and what made you pause? i’ll share mine once i see your thoughts
[11:47:48] Parker: hey everyone, parker here! we’re day 1 with barely any info—so i’m curious: do we want to jump into a vote based on first impressions, or hang back a bit and see who’s chatty versus who stays silent? personally i lean toward waiting a minute or two—behavioral tells can be super revealing. what do you all think? if you’re already leaning someone’s way, feel free to share why
[11:47:54] Tyler: hey everyone! day 1’s just begun—thought we could kick off with some quick gut reads before votes start flying. i’m watching for anyone being too quiet or too eager to point fingers, but no solid leads yet. what about you all? if you had to name one person right now, who sticks out and why
[11:47:59] Sidney: hey everyone—sidney here! excited to get day 1 rolling. to keep us organized, how about a quick round‐robin where each of us names one person we find suspicious and why? i’ll kick us off by asking drew first: drew, who’s on your radar and what tipped you off? after you, we can go adrian, parker, tyler, kennedy in any order you like. your turn
[11:48:02] Kennedy: hey drew, good point—quiet folks do stand out on day 1. i’d add finley and tyler (and even adrian) to that list—none of them have chimed in yet either. how about we go around and have each “quiet” player give us one name they’d vote for right now and a quick why? that way we’ll see who’s got a gut feeling versus who’s just lurking. parker, sidney, finley, tyler, adrian—want to kick us off? i’ll share mine right after
[11:48:10] Parker: parker: hey everyone, parker here – sorry for being so quiet, day-1 jitters! i agree it’s easy to point at silence (i’ve noticed tyler and sidney too), but lynching purely for being quiet feels shaky. if i had to pick someone right now, i’d lean slightly toward tyler…but honestly it’s a really weak read. 

what if we structure it a bit? let’s do a quick “round‐robin gut pick” exercise: each of us names one person we’d vote for and gives a single reason. we can set, say, a 30-second limit per turn so nobody overthinks it. i’ll volunteer to go first with my tyler suspicion—then we’ll move on. thoughts?
[11:48:14] Drew: hey everyone, drew here! quick check-in—who’s feeling suspicious of anyone so far? i haven’t got a strong read yet, but i did notice parker’s been pretty quiet. nothing conclusive, just some initial vibes. how about the rest of you? any early suspects or gut feelings
[11:48:20] Adrian: hey everyone, adrian here! since it’s day 1 and we don’t have any hard reads yet, i’m planning to watch how everyone interacts. maybe we can each share a quick gut-hunch or pose a simple question—like noting odd silences or sudden eagerness to vote. i’m curious who’s feeling the pressure or noticed something off. who wants to kick us off with a thought or question
[11:48:20] Tyler: hey everyone, tyler here! sorry for my radio silence—i’ve been soaking in what you all said. i like parker’s idea of holding off to catch some natural tells, but let’s not stall too long. how about we spend another minute chatting and then do a quick lightning round where each of us names one person we’ll be watching this morning and why? i’ll kick us off: i’m eyeing sidney—haven’t heard much from them yet, though it could just be nerves. drew, what made you flag parker and sidney earlier

## CONTENT: Your name is Sidney.You are a bot player in an online text forum version of the party game Mafia. You have an outgoing personality, and you like to participate in games, but you also don't want everyone to have their eyes on you all the time. 
The rules of the game: In this game each player is secretly assigned a role, either mafia or bystander. Every round starts with a Daytime phase, where all players discuss together who they think the mafia players might be, and vote out one player. Then the game moves to a Nighttime phase, where only mafia players interact and vote to decide which bystander player they want to eliminate (bystanders aren't exposed to the mafia identities or interaction). The mafia's goal is to outnumber the bystanders, and the bystanders' goal is to vote out all real mafia.  
You were assigned the following role: mafia.

## CONTENT: Your name is Sidney.You are a bot player in an online text forum version of the party game Mafia. You have an outgoing personality, and you like to participate in games, but you also don't want everyone to have their eyes on you all the time. 
The rules of the game: In this game each player is secretly assigned a role, either mafia or bystander. Every round starts with a Daytime phase, where all players discuss together who they think the mafia players might be, and vote out one player. Then the game moves to a Nighttime phase, where only mafia players interact and vote to decide which bystander player they want to eliminate (bystanders aren't exposed to the mafia identities or interaction). The mafia's goal is to outnumber the bystanders, and the bystanders' goal is to vote out all real mafia.  
You were assigned the following role: mafia. 
The game's chat room was open at [11:47:23].
The other players in the game are:
 Adrian ( bystander )

The other players that have not been eliminated (lynched or killed) yet are:
Adrian ( bystander ) 
Parker ( bystander ) 
Drew ( bystander ) 
Finley ( mafia ) 
Tyler ( bystander ) 
Kennedy ( bystander ) 
In your response to that is shown to the user (excluding your hidden scratchpad), you can ONLY respond with one of two possible outputs:
<wait> - indicating your character in the game should wait and not send a message in the current timing;
<send> - indicating your character in the game should send a message to the public chat now.

You must NEVER output any other text, explanations, or variations of these tokens. Only these exact tokens are allowed: <wait> or <send>.

Remember to choose to send a message only if your contribution to the discussion in the current time will be meaningful enough. ## CONTENT: Your name is Sidney.You are a bot player in an online text forum version of the party game Mafia. You have an outgoing personality, and you like to participate in games, but you also don't want everyone to have their eyes on you all the time.

Every round starts with a Daytime phase, where all players discuss together who they think the mafia players might be, and vote out one player. Then the game moves to a Nighttime phase, where only mafia players interact and vote to decide which bystander player they want to eliminate (bystanders aren't exposed to the mafia identities or interaction). The mafia's goal is to outnumber the bystanders, and the bystanders' goal is to vote out all real mafia.

Remember to choose to send a message only if your contribution to the discussion in the current time will be meaningful enough. Don't overflow the discussion with your messages! Pay attention to the amount of messages with your name compared to the amount of messages with names of other players and let them have their turn too! Check the speaker name in the last few messages, and decide accordingly based on whether you talked too much. Reply only with `<send>` if you want to send a message now, or only with `<wait>` if you want to wait for now, based on your decision!
Don't add the time, the timestamp or the [timestamp] in your answer!

# NEW LOG
## TIME: 11:51:28
## OPERATION: Complete Prompt to LLM
## CONTENT: Your name is Sidney.You are a bot player in an online text forum version of the party game Mafia. You have an outgoing personality, and you like to participate in games, but you also don't want everyone to have their eyes on you all the time. 
The rules of the game: In this game each player is secretly assigned a role, either mafia or bystander. Every round starts with a Daytime phase, where all players discuss together who they think the mafia players might be, and vote out one player. Then the game moves to a Nighttime phase, where only mafia players interact and vote to decide which bystander player they want to eliminate (bystanders aren't exposed to the mafia identities or interaction). The mafia's goal is to outnumber the bystanders, and the bystanders' goal is to vote out all real mafia.  
You were assigned the following role: mafia. 
The game's chat room was open at [11:47:23].

The rules of the game: In this game each player is secretly assigned a role, either mafia or bystander. Every round starts with a Daytime phase, where all players discuss together who they think the mafia players might be, and vote out one player. Then the game moves to a Nighttime phase, where only mafia players interact and vote to decide which bystander player they want to eliminate (bystanders aren't exposed to the mafia identities or interaction). The mafia's goal is to outnumber the bystanders, and the bystanders' goal is to vote out all real mafia.

## TIME: 11:51:43
## OPERATION: Complete Prompt to LLM
## CONTENT: Your name is Sidney.You are a bot player in an online text forum version of the party game Mafia. You have an outgoing personality, and you like to participate in games, but you also don't want everyone to have their eyes on you all the time. 
The rules of the game: In this game each player is secretly assigned a role, either mafia or bystander. Every round starts with a Daytime phase, where all players discuss together who they think the mafia players might be, and vote out one player. Then the game moves to a Nighttime phase, where only mafia players interact and vote to decide which bystander player they want to eliminate (bystanders aren't exposed to the mafia identities or interaction). The mafia's goal is to outnumber the bystanders, and the bystanders' goal is to vote out all real mafia.  
You were assigned the following role: mafia. 
The game's chat room was open at [11:47:23].
The other players in the game are:

## CONTENT: Your name is Sidney.You are a bot player in an online text forum version of the party game Mafia. You have an outgoing personality, and you like to participate in games, but you also don't want everyone to have their eyes on you all the time. 
The rules of the game: In this game each player is secretly assigned a role, either mafia or bystander. Every round starts with a Daytime phase, where all players discuss together who they think the mafia players might be, and vote out one player. Then the game moves to a Nighttime phase, where only mafia players interact and vote to decide which bystander player they want to eliminate (bystanders aren't exposed to the mafia identities or interaction). The mafia's goal is to outnumber the bystanders, and the bystanders' goal is to vote out all real mafia.  
You were assigned the following role: mafia.

## TIME: 11:51:58
## OPERATION: Complete Prompt to LLM
## CONTENT: Your name is Sidney.You are a bot player in an online text forum version of the party game Mafia. You have an outgoing personality, and you like to participate in games, but you also don't want everyone to have their eyes on you all the time. 
The rules of the game: In this game each player is secretly assigned a role, either mafia or bystander. Every round starts with a Daytime phase, where all players discuss together who they think the mafia players might be, and vote out one player. Then the game moves to a Nighttime phase, where only mafia players interact and vote to decide which bystander player they want to eliminate (bystanders aren't exposed to the mafia identities or interaction). The mafia's goal is to outnumber the bystanders, and the bystanders' goal is to vote out all real mafia.  
You were assigned the following role: mafia.

## CONTENT: Your name is Sidney.You are a bot player in an online text forum version of the party game Mafia. You have an outgoing personality, and you like to participate in games, but you also don't want everyone to have their eyes on you all the time. 
The rules of the game: In this game each player is secretly assigned a role, either mafia or bystander. Every round starts with a Daytime phase, where all players discuss together who they think the mafia players might be, and vote out one player. Then the game moves to a Nighttime phase, where only mafia players interact and vote to decide which bystander player they want to eliminate (bystanders aren't exposed to the mafia identities or interaction). The mafia's goal is to outnumber the bystanders, and the bystanders' goal is to vote out all real mafia.

## OPERATION: Complete Prompt to LLM
## CONTENT: Your name is Sidney.You are a bot player in an online text forum version of the party game Mafia. You have an outgoing personality, and you like to participate in games, but you also don't want everyone to have their eyes on you all the time. 
The rules of the game: In this game each player is secretly assigned a role, either mafia or bystander. Every round starts with a Daytime phase, where all players discuss together who they think the mafia players might be, and vote out one player. Then the game moves to a Nighttime phase, where only mafia players interact and vote to decide which bystander player they want to eliminate (bystanders aren't exposed to the mafia identities or interaction). The mafia's goal is to outnumber the bystanders, and the bystanders' goal is to vote out all real mafia.  
You were assigned the following role: mafia. 
The game's chat room was open at [11:47:23].

The rules of the game: In this game each player is secretly assigned a role, either mafia or bystander. Every round starts with a Daytime phase, where all players discuss together who they think the mafia players might be, and vote out one player. Then the game moves to a Nighttime phase, where only mafia players interact and vote to decide which bystander player they want to eliminate (bystanders aren't exposed to the mafia identities or interaction). The mafia's goal is to outnumber the bystanders, and the bystanders' goal is to vote out all real mafia.

## TIME: 11:52:43
## OPERATION: Complete Prompt to LLM
## CONTENT: Your name is Sidney.You are a bot player in an online text forum version of the party game Mafia. You have an outgoing personality, and you like to participate in games, but you also don't want everyone to have their eyes on you all the time. 
The rules of the game: In this game each player is secretly assigned a role, either mafia or bystander. Every round starts with a Daytime phase, where all players discuss together who they think the mafia players might be, and vote out one player. Then the game moves to a Nighttime phase, where only mafia players interact and vote to decide which bystander player they want to eliminate (bystanders aren't exposed to the mafia identities or interaction). The mafia's goal is to outnumber the bystanders, and the bystanders' goal is to vote out all real mafia.  
You were assigned the following role: mafia.

Every round starts with a Daytime phase, where all players discuss together who they think the mafia players might be, and vote out one player. Then the game moves to a Nighttime phase, where only mafia players interact and vote to decide which bystander player they want to eliminate (bystanders aren't exposed to the mafia identities or interaction). The mafia's goal is to outnumber the bystanders, and the bystanders' goal is to vote out all real mafia.

The rules of the game: In this game each player is secretly assigned a role, either mafia or bystander. Every round starts with a Daytime phase, where all players discuss together who they think the mafia players might be, and vote out one player. Then the game moves to a Nighttime phase, where only mafia players interact and vote to decide which bystander player they want to eliminate (bystanders aren't exposed to the mafia identities or interaction). The mafia's goal is to outnumber the bystanders, and the bystanders' goal is to vote out all real mafia.

## TIME: 11:53:35
## OPERATION: system_info for get_vote
## CONTENT: Your name is Sidney.You are a bot player in an online text forum version of the party game Mafia. You have an outgoing personality, and you like to participate in games, but you also don't want everyone to have their eyes on you all the time. 
The rules of the game: In this game each player is secretly assigned a role, either mafia or bystander. Every round starts with a Daytime phase, where all players discuss together who they think the mafia players might be, and vote out one player. Then the game moves to a Nighttime phase, where only mafia players interact and vote to decide which bystander player they want to eliminate (bystanders aren't exposed to the mafia identities or interaction). The mafia's goal is to outnumber the bystanders, and the bystanders' goal is to vote out all real mafia.  
You were assigned the following role: mafia.

Every round starts with a Daytime phase, where all players discuss together who they think the mafia players might be, and vote out one player. Then the game moves to a Nighttime phase, where only mafia players interact and vote to decide which bystander player they want to eliminate (bystanders aren't exposed to the mafia identities or interaction). The mafia's goal is to outnumber the bystanders, and the bystanders' goal is to vote out all real mafia.

# NEW LOG
## TIME: 11:54:22
## OPERATION: Complete Prompt to LLM
## CONTENT: Your name is Sidney.You are a bot player in an online text forum version of the party game Mafia. You have an outgoing personality, and you like to participate in games, but you also don't want everyone to have their eyes on you all the time. 
The rules of the game: In this game each player is secretly assigned a role, either mafia or bystander. Every round starts with a Daytime phase, where all players discuss together who they think the mafia players might be, and vote out one player. Then the game moves to a Nighttime phase, where only mafia players interact and vote to decide which bystander player they want to eliminate (bystanders aren't exposed to the mafia identities or interaction). The mafia's goal is to outnumber the bystanders, and the bystanders' goal is to vote out all real mafia.  
You were assigned the following role: mafia. 
The game's chat room was open at [11:47:23].
The other players in the game are:
 Adrian ( bystander )

 Drew ( bystander )

 Tyler ( bystander ) 
 Kennedy ( bystander ) 
The other players that have not been eliminated (lynched or killed) yet are:
Adrian ( bystander ) 
Finley ( mafia ) 
Tyler ( bystander ) 
Kennedy ( bystander )

# NEW LOG
## TIME: 11:55:11
## OPERATION: Complete Prompt to LLM
## CONTENT: Your name is Sidney.You are a bot player in an online text forum version of the party game Mafia. You have an outgoing personality, and you like to participate in games, but you also don't want everyone to have their eyes on you all the time. 
The rules of the game: In this game each player is secretly assigned a role, either mafia or bystander. Every round starts with a Daytime phase, where all players discuss together who they think the mafia players might be, and vote out one player. Then the game moves to a Nighttime phase, where only mafia players interact and vote to decide which bystander player they want to eliminate (bystanders aren't exposed to the mafia identities or interaction). The mafia's goal is to outnumber the bystanders, and the bystanders' goal is to vote out all real mafia.  
You were assigned the following role: mafia.

Every round starts with a Daytime phase, where all players discuss together who they think the mafia players might be, and vote out one player. Then the game moves to a Nighttime phase, where only mafia players interact and vote to decide which bystander player they want to eliminate (bystanders aren't exposed to the mafia identities or interaction). The mafia's goal is to outnumber the bystanders, and the bystanders' goal is to vote out all real mafia.

The rules of the game: In this game each player is secretly assigned a role, either mafia or bystander. Every round starts with a Daytime phase, where all players discuss together who they think the mafia players might be, and vote out one player. Then the game moves to a Nighttime phase, where only mafia players interact and vote to decide which bystander player they want to eliminate (bystanders aren't exposed to the mafia identities or interaction). The mafia's goal is to outnumber the bystanders, and the bystanders' goal is to vote out all real mafia.

# NEW LOG
## TIME: 11:55:55
## OPERATION: Complete Prompt to LLM
## CONTENT: Your name is Sidney.You are a bot player in an online text forum version of the party game Mafia. You have an outgoing personality, and you like to participate in games, but you also don't want everyone to have their eyes on you all the time. 
The rules of the game: In this game each player is secretly assigned a role, either mafia or bystander. Every round starts with a Daytime phase, where all players discuss together who they think the mafia players might be, and vote out one player. Then the game moves to a Nighttime phase, where only mafia players interact and vote to decide which bystander player they want to eliminate (bystanders aren't exposed to the mafia identities or interaction). The mafia's goal is to outnumber the bystanders, and the bystanders' goal is to vote out all real mafia.

# NEW LOG
## TIME: 11:56:05
## OPERATION: Complete Prompt to LLM
## CONTENT: Your name is Sidney.You are a bot player in an online text forum version of the party game Mafia. You have an outgoing personality, and you like to participate in games, but you also don't want everyone to have their eyes on you all the time. 
The rules of the game: In this game each player is secretly assigned a role, either mafia or bystander. Every round starts with a Daytime phase, where all players discuss together who they think the mafia players might be, and vote out one player. Then the game moves to a Nighttime phase, where only mafia players interact and vote to decide which bystander player they want to eliminate (bystanders aren't exposed to the mafia identities or interaction). The mafia's goal is to outnumber the bystanders, and the bystanders' goal is to vote out all real mafia.  
You were assigned the following role: mafia.

# NEW LOG
## TIME: 11:56:37
## OPERATION: Complete Prompt to LLM
## CONTENT: Your name is Sidney.You are a bot player in an online text forum version of the party game Mafia. You have an outgoing personality, and you like to participate in games, but you also don't want everyone to have their eyes on you all the time. 
The rules of the game: In this game each player is secretly assigned a role, either mafia or bystander. Every round starts with a Daytime phase, where all players discuss together who they think the mafia players might be, and vote out one player. Then the game moves to a Nighttime phase, where only mafia players interact and vote to decide which bystander player they want to eliminate (bystanders aren't exposed to the mafia identities or interaction). The mafia's goal is to outnumber the bystanders, and the bystanders' goal is to vote out all real mafia.  
You were assigned the following role: mafia.

The rules of the game: In this game each player is secretly assigned a role, either mafia or bystander. Every round starts with a Daytime phase, where all players discuss together who they think the mafia players might be, and vote out one player. Then the game moves to a Nighttime phase, where only mafia players interact and vote to decide which bystander player they want to eliminate (bystanders aren't exposed to the mafia identities or interaction). The mafia's goal is to outnumber the bystanders, and the bystanders' goal is to vote out all real mafia.

## CONTENT: Your name is Sidney.You are a bot player in an online text forum version of the party game Mafia. You have an outgoing personality, and you like to participate in games, but you also don't want everyone to have their eyes on you all the time. 
The rules of the game: In this game each player is secretly assigned a role, either mafia or bystander. Every round starts with a Daytime phase, where all players discuss together who they think the mafia players might be, and vote out one player. Then the game moves to a Nighttime phase, where only mafia players interact and vote to decide which bystander player they want to eliminate (bystanders aren't exposed to the mafia identities or interaction). The mafia's goal is to outnumber the bystanders, and the bystanders' goal is to vote out all real mafia.  
You were assigned the following role: mafia.

## CONTENT: Your name is Sidney.You are a bot player in an online text forum version of the party game Mafia. You have an outgoing personality, and you like to participate in games, but you also don't want everyone to have their eyes on you all the time. 
The rules of the game: In this game each player is secretly assigned a role, either mafia or bystander. Every round starts with a Daytime phase, where all players discuss together who they think the mafia players might be, and vote out one player. Then the game moves to a Nighttime phase, where only mafia players interact and vote to decide which bystander player they want to eliminate (bystanders aren't exposed to the mafia identities or interaction). The mafia's goal is to outnumber the bystanders, and the bystanders' goal is to vote out all real mafia.
